newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: PepsiCo pulls plug on S.Africa NAB - paper.
newsitem.headline: PepsiCo pulls plug on S.Africa NAB - paper.

text.p: PepsiCo International has applied for the voluntary liquidation of local bottler New Age Beverages (NAB), just three years after it made a high-profile return to South Africa, Business Report said on Friday.
The liquidation application was confirmed on Thursday by Pule Pule, NAB's corporate and public affiars manager, the paper said.
PepsiCo holds 25 percent of the shares and local black business owns eight percent. The rest is held by African-American investors.
Pule said the company had been experiencing a severe financial crisis for a long time and had asked its African-American investors to pump in more money, to which they had agreed.
But, as a part of the agreement, the investors required that other shareholders be involved.
Standard Bank Investment Corp Ltd was approached for a loan of 300 million rand by tHe African-American investors, but it required a guarantee.
PepsiCo declined to provide this, the paper said.
Pule said the differences betweeen the bank and PepsiCo had cost them the company. He said PepsiCo's decision not to provide surety came as a shock.
In the absence of any further help from either PepsiCo or the African-American investors, the "company had decided to close shop," Pule said.
